content: t imber t rail h at by jennifer lysen for cedar house yarns materials one skein old growth worsted yarn size us 7 circular needle or dpns or size needed to make gauge size us 8 circular needle or dpns or size needed to make gauge six stitch markers tapestry needle cable needle gauge 18 st and 22 rounds = 4 inches on larger needles stockinette stitch knitted in the round sizes baby bear child fits 18 19 circumference shown in prairie fire mama bear adult m fits 20 21 circumference shown in pacific bleeding heart papa bear adult l fits 22 23 circumference shown in ginger stitch guide co cast on round round k knit p purl dpns double pointed needles st stitch k2tog knit 2 together left cable slip first 2 st onto cable needle hold in front knit next 2 st return st from cable needle and knit brim co 84 90 96 with smaller needles using a long tail cast on place marker and join being careful not to twist *k1 p1* repeat to the end of the round repeat until the piece measures 1 1 5 2 from co edge body change to larger needles k 28 30 32 work cable chart see below k to end of the round repeat until the piece measures 7 8 5 9 from co edge decrease set up round *k 12 13 14 k2tog place marker* repeat to end of the round maintaining cable motif round 1 *k to 2st before marker k2tog* repeat to end of the round maintaining cable motif round 2 k to end of round maintaining cable motif repeat round 1 & 2 until there are 6 8 12 st in between markers next round k2tog to the end of the round next round k to end of round repeat last 2 rnds until there are 6 9 9 stitches remaining finishing break yarn with at least an 8 tail weave the tail through the remaining 8 stitches and weave in the end
